alerts.description: Ferrous sulfate can reduce the absorption of levothyroxine.  Taking them together may require adjusting the levothyroxine dose to maintain therapeutic levels.  The interaction is more significant if taken simultaneously.
alerts.recommendation: Administer ferrous sulfate and levothyroxine at least 4 hours apart. Monitor TSH levels closely to ensure adequate thyroid hormone replacement. Consider alternative iron formulations with better bioavailability if absorption issues persist.

alerts.description: While not a major interaction, high doses of iron can theoretically interfere with the absorption of vitamin B12. However, this is less likely with standard doses.
alerts.recommendation: Administer ferrous sulfate and vitamin B12 at least 2 hours apart. Monitor vitamin B12 levels if symptoms persist.
